meta.content:
Email: dpurviance@allenschools.org - Google Classroom
I have created a Google Classroom and signed up each student. This will be a way that the class can communicate with each other, post pictures, videos, recipes, fun activities, or anything academic they are doing at home. I encourage everyone to use this to communicate, not as a social media platform. This is the first time I have ever used this platform, so play around a little and get to know it. I will be...

input.name: artSection
input.value: Academic Opportunities for Students During Closure|5th Grade Information>>Information on Google Classroom

span.span: I have created a Google Classroom and signed up each student. This will be a way that the class can communicate with each other, post pictures, videos, recipes, fun activities, or anything academic they are doing at home. I encourage everyone to use this to communicate, not as a social media platform. This is the first time I have ever used this platform, so play around a little and get to know it. I will be doing the same, and hopefully be able to some fun activities in the future.
Here are some steps to get your student logged in.
Enter the student’s email (first initial plus last name @allenschools.org)
These are the same as if they were signing into a chromebook at school
When they are signed in there is a 3 x 3 row of dots. Click on the dots.
A drop down menu will come up with different options.
Click on the Google classroom icon
The title of our “Classroom” is Third Grade ’19-‘20
Click on that icon and hopefully you should be in our classroom
I have posted something already to let me know you have logged in successfully
There is also a “Google Classroom” app that can be downloaded as well. If at any point it asks for a class code, the code is 7ba3wcg. Please let me know if there are any addition questions.
